title: Mental Health Simulation-Based Language Intervention Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mental health concepts and speech-language pathology knowledge
context.additional_context: Language intervention practice environments utilizing digital devices and simulation tools

learning_goals: Learners can accurately apply language intervention techniques with over 80% accuracy in simulation scenarios with high psychological fidelity.
Learners can execute at least three verbal communication strategies when interacting with children with mental health challenges through simulation-based role-play.
Learners can self-evaluate their intervention skills and develop improvement plans using a simulation feedback system.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
